info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 4:24PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Hamilton and northwestern Warren Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 423 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lake Pleasant, or 8 miles southwest of Speculator, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Speculator, Johnsburg, Lake Pleasant, Chestertown, North Creek, Moffitt Beach Campground, Byrnes Corners, Garnet Lake, Sodom, Riparius, Perkins Clearing, Rudeston, Edwards Hill, Christian Hill, Wevertown, Holcombville, North River, Igerna, Sled Harbor and Bakers Mills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized poor drainage flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for eastern and east central New York.
